016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.component;
017
018import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
019import java.lang.annotation.Repeatable;
020import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
021import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
022import java.lang.annotation.Target;
023import java.util.Collection;
024
025import javax.el.ValueExpression;
026
027import de.cuioss.test.jsf.component.AbstractComponentTest;
028import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.api.property.PropertyConfig;
029import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.property.PropertyMetadata;
030import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.property.util.AssertionStrategy;
031
032/**
033 * If used on {@link AbstractComponentTest} type configures the property-tests.
034 * <p>
035 * In essence it checks the getters and setters. As default it assumes the
036 * individual properties to not provide a default value. This can be controlled
037 * using {@link #defaultValued()}
038 *
039 * @author Oliver Wolff
040 */
041@Repeatable(VerifyComponentPropertiesRepeat.class)
042@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
043@Target({ ElementType.TYPE })
044public @interface VerifyComponentProperties {
045
046    /**
047     * @return a number of properties, identified by their names that are to be
048     *         considered for this test: white-list
049     */
050    String[] of() default {};
051
052    /**
053     * @return a number of properties, identified by their names that are to be
054     *         treated as having a default values, see
055     *         {@link PropertyMetadata#isDefaultValue()}
056     */
057    String[] defaultValued() default {};
058
059    /**
060     * @return a number of properties, identified by their names that are to be
061     *         ignore on the tests with {@link ValueExpression}s. <em>Caution</em>
062     *         the need of the configuration hints on an invalid implementation,
063     *         because all properties should consider {@link ValueExpression}s.
064     */
065    String[] noValueExpression() default {};
066
067    /**
068     * @return a number of properties, identified by their names representing at
069     *         least a {@link Collection} that are to be asserted ignoring the
070     *         concrete order, see {@link PropertyConfig#assertionStrategy()} and
071     *         {@link AssertionStrategy#COLLECTION_IGNORE_ORDER}. The default
072     *         implementation will always respect / assert the same order of
073     *         elements.
074     */
075    String[] assertUnorderedCollection() default {};
076}
